intro: Hemisphaera bellidifolia, commonly known as the bellflower of the Mediterranean, is a flowering plant native to the rocky regions of southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hemispherical or spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to purple, bloom in early spring and are followed by small, bladder-like fruits. Hemisphaera bellidifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
